title: Bake Off has totally lost the plot - it's abandoned the things which made it special
text:
As the nights draw in, there’s nothing like an hour of cosy, appointment TV. And for the past ten series, nothing has been cosier and more appointment-worthy than The Great British Bake Off.

Until now.

All the genuine joy and bumbling amateur fun has drained from the programme like yuzu juice through a sieve. And as the 2019 final approaches on Tuesday, I find myself relieved it will soon all be over.

Part of the problem is the team. In the olden days, when it was a BBC staple and cheerful presenters Mel and Sue bustled supportively round the tent, firing off innuendo and shoring up weeping hopefuls, it was easy to imagine ourselves right there with them.

Now, on Channel 4, we have comedians...
description: As the nights draw in, there’s nothing like an hour of cosy, appointment TV.
